intro: Dichorisandra affinis, commonly known as the African lily, is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family. It is a flowering plant native to southern Africa, characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a bulbous perennial, with strap-like leaves that emerge from the base. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for gardens. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long blooming period and ability to naturalize in suitable climates.
